content.raw:
Oh, that would be pretty good then. I hadn’t thought of hard-coding a list but then checking whether the paths actually exist. That means we can check multiple paths for each app even. Maintaining the list won’t be much work since they don’t change _that_ often, and we can just bruteforce checking all of the program files/program files x86/local appdata/whatever the other appdata one is folders.  
I wonder if there’s a way to just get a list of “all applications that can open a file” and scan them for keywords. When I said getting this info programatically was hard, I had been looking at “how to get the default text editor”, i.e. asking windows about file association. But perhaps a list of all apps might be more available. Might see what I can find.
